item.title: math 0
item.description: Pursuit Curve A curve of pursuit is a curve constructed by analogy to having a point or points representing pursuers and pursuees; the curve of pursuit is the curve traced by the pursuers. With the paths of the pursuer and pursuee parameterized in time, the pursuee is always on the pursuer’s tangent. e.g. one plane chasing another. The plane that is being chased must have predetermined path (flying upwards, in circle etc.
